To invite new employees as card users only, follow these steps:

  1. Go to the "Dashboard" or "Members" page.
  2. Click the "Invite member" button.
  3. Enter the employee's title, first name, last name, and email address.
  4. Leave all role checkboxes unchecked. This will automatically assign the Cardholder role, which is the default for all members.
  5. Choose whether to directly issue a card for the member.
  6. Click "Send invite" to email the invitation.

By not selecting any additional roles, the new employee will only have access to the cardholder app and their own cards, which is typically sufficient for most employees.

Morris Be√üer:

Hallo, warum kann ich als Admin Kreditkartenlimits nicht √§ndern?

Pliant:

As an admin, you should be able to change credit card limits. However, there are a few factors to consider:

  1. Your permissions: Admins have card issuance permissions, which include the ability to change card limits.
  2. Maximum limit: There's a maximum limit that admins can grant when issuing a new card or changing an existing card's limit. This maximum limit is set by the Owner and can only be changed by them.
  3. Organization limit: Card limits are dependent on the overall organization limit. If the organization limit is reached, you won't be able to increase card limits beyond that.

To change a card's limits, navigate to the card on the cards page in the Admin App and click 'Change limits'. Select the new limit values and confirm. The changes should apply immediately.

If you're still unable to change limits, please contact an Owner to review your permissions or the organization's overall limit.


Sources:
Managing cards via the admin app
Member roles and permissions
Understanding Pliant Credit Card and Organisation Limits

We offer cashback on purchases made with your Pliant card. The cashback is earned in the currency of the account used for the transaction. For example, if you have accounts in EUR, USD, and GBP, you'll earn cashback in those respective currencies.

If you're using a credit line, cashback will be issued in the same currency as the account. For instance, a USD credit line will earn cashback in USD for transactions.

To maximize your cashback, you might consider opting for more frequent or earlier bill payments. This can result in higher cashback amounts.

Melissa Wenzlawski:

Admin role for an user

Pliant:

To assign an admin role to a user, you need to be an owner of the organization. Here's how you can do it:

  1. Go to the "Dashboard" or "Members" page in our admin app.
  2. Click on the "Invite member" button.
  3. Enter the user's details (title, first name, last name, and email address).
  4. Select the "Admin" role from the checkboxes.
  5. Choose whether the admin can issue cards to themselves and set their maximum monthly card limit.
  6. Click "Send invite" to email the invitation.

If the user is already a member, you can change their role:

  1. Go to the "Members" page.
  2. Find the user and click on their profile.
  3. Change their role to "Admin".

Remember, only owners can assign or change admin roles.

If your card hasn't arrived, you'll need to terminate it before requesting a new one. Here's what to do:

  1. Go to the "Wallet" in our web or mobile app.
  2. Click the edit button for the card.
  3. Select "Terminate card" and choose a reason.
  4. Confirm the termination.

  1. In the "Wallet", click "Request new card" (web) or the plus sign (mobile).
  2. Choose the card type.
  3. Enter the required details and reason for the request.
  4. Submit for approval.

Keep in mind, physical cards usually take 5-10 working days to arrive. If you need further assistance, please don't hesitate to ask.

To activate your physical card, follow these steps:

We provide several ways to access and review your card transaction details. In our admin app, you can view all transactions made by members of your organization on the Transactions page. Here, transactions appear in real-time as they're authorized, and you can search and filter as needed.

For specific card details, you can access these through the cardholder app. In the "My Cards" section of your wallet, you can view card numbers and CVV codes. For virtual cards, this is the only way to access card details.

It's important to note that secure card details (number, CVV, and PIN) can only be accessed by the cardholder to whom the card was issued. For security reasons, these details should never be shared with anyone else.

Julia Sch√∂ngart:

Guten Morgen, ich kann eine Abbuchung nicht im Buchhaltungsreport finden, obwohl die Abbuchung auf der Monatsabrechnung vorhanden ist.

Pliant:

There could be a few reasons why a deduction appears on your monthly statement but not in the accounting report:

  1. Timing differences: The monthly statement includes transactions based on the calendar month, while the accounting report may use different cut-off dates.
  2. Booking date vs. Transaction date: The accounting report typically shows confirmed transactions sorted by booking date, which may differ from the transaction date.
  3. Export status: If the transaction hasn't been exported to the accounting system yet, it won't appear in the accounting report.

To investigate further, check the transaction's booking date and export status in our app. If you still can't locate the deduction, please provide more details about the specific transaction and we can assist you further.

I cannot login with the app ?

Pliant:

There could be a few reasons why you're having trouble logging in with the app. Here are some key points to consider:

  1. We use two-factor authentication (2FA) for security. You need to provide your password and a second form of verification.
  2. By default, you'll receive an SMS code for 2FA. Make sure your registered mobile number is correct.
  3. Alternatively, you can pair your mobile device for easier login. This allows you to use push notifications instead of SMS codes.
  4. If you've paired your device but aren't receiving push notifications, try unpairing and re-pairing your device.
  5. Ensure your password meets our minimum requirements: at least 8 characters long and includes 3 out of 4 character types (lowercase, uppercase, numbers, special characters).

If you're still having issues, please provide more details about the specific problem you're encountering.

Two Factor Authentication (2FA) Through Push Notification
Password Security at Pliant

Pliant:

There are several reasons why an employee's payment might be rejected. Common causes include:

  1. The card is locked.
  2. The card or organizational limit has been reached.
  3. An incorrect PIN was entered.
  4. Customer authentication failed.
  5. The merchant is disallowed.
  6. The transaction occurred in a prohibited or high-risk country.

For online payments, a missing cardholder authentication can cause rejection. In this case, the employee should contact the merchant to trigger the authentication process.

If you need more details about a specific declined transaction, please check your email for notifications or contact our support team for assistance.


Sources:
Strong-Customer Authentication
Declined transactions

Pliant:

There are several reasons why cardholder authentication might fail for an employee's payment:

  1. The Pliant mobile app may need to be updated to receive the 3DS push notification.
  2. The merchant might not have sent a request for Strong Customer Authentication (SCA), even though it's required for the card payment.
  3. The employee may have entered the SMS code incorrectly.
  4. The employee or merchant may have canceled the payment.
  5. A temporary blocking of the 3DS function can occur if the payment is canceled or the wrong code is entered multiple times.

If you're concerned about a blocked 3DS function, please reach out to our support team through our support form. For online payments, contact the merchant to trigger the authentication process on their side.

Export Daten DATEV XML oder DATEV CSV

Pliant:

To export data in DATEV XML or DATEV CSV format, follow these steps:

  1. Go to the Accounting Export tab in our app.
  2. Select the transactions you want to export and add them to the export list.
  3. Click on "Export selected" to open the export window.
  4. In the export window, change the export format from the default DATEV API to either DATEV XML (for DUO) or DATEV CSV (for Kanzlei Rechnungswesen).
  5. Click on "Start export" to initiate the process.

After the export, you'll find the exported transactions in the "Exported" tab, including the export date and ID. If you need to re-export transactions, you can do so using DATEV XML or DATEV CSV formats.

I want to integrate DATEV

Pliant:

To integrate DATEV with our accounting and billing system, follow these steps:

  1. Submit a ticket to activate DATEV integration for your organization.
  2. Set up prerequisites in DATEV and our app, including correct DATEV client setup, extended processing form in DUO, and activation of DATEV Invoice Data Service 1.0.
  3. In our app, go to Settings - Accounting - DATEV and click "Connect DATEV Datenservices". Log in to DATEV, grant permissions, and select your DATEV client.
  4. To export transactions, go to the Accounting Export tab, select transactions, and add them to the export list. Click "Export selected" and choose DATEV API as the export format.

Remember, you can revoke the authorization at any time, and the setup needs to be done only once.

Philipp Carl:

I have a question to the FX Fee and how it works:

Pliant:

We apply a fee to each foreign exchange (FX) transaction, which are transactions made in a currency different from your card account's currency. The general FX fee is 2%, but your organization may have a special rate. You can check your specific FX fee rate on the Organization > Plan page in our app.

We calculate the FX fee as soon as a transaction is booked. At the end of each month, we sum up all the FX fees for that month's transactions and add the total to your monthly invoice. The FX fee per transaction and the applicable rate are included in the transaction CSV export for your reference.


Source:
Fees on FX transactions

Philipp Carl:

could you explain me, how it exactly works:

- the caard currency is EUR
- case 1: when I am in Switzerland and I do a payment in CHF, then the FX fee is applied, correct?
- case 2: when I am in Switzerland and I do a payment in EUR, is the FX then also applied or not?

Pliant:

Yes, the FX fee is applied when you make a payment in CHF in Switzerland with a EUR card, as this is considered an FX transaction. However, when you make a payment in EUR in Switzerland with a EUR card, no FX fee is applied since the transaction currency matches your card account currency.

The general FX fee rate is 2%, but your organization may have a special rate. You can check your specific FX fee rate on the Organization > Plan page in your account settings.

Remember, FX fees are calculated when a transaction is booked and added to your monthly invoice at the end of each calendar month.


Source:
Fees on FX transactions

Dear Team, I have a hold on my credit card from 24.10.2024 from the Pealr Rotana Hotel 3C with the amount of 180 AED (45‚Ç¨). The costs for this transaction were settled on 26.10.2024 in the amount of ‚Ç¨ 48.28. However, my credit card still shows the outstanding payment. The hotel itself could not see this hold in their accounts. Could you please delete this from my transactions?

Pliant:

The hold you're seeing is likely a pending transaction, which is common in the hotel industry. Pending transactions can take up to 7 days to be confirmed and change to a booked status. Unfortunately, we can't cancel a pending transaction.

If the actual transaction has been settled, the pending hold should automatically disappear within a few days. If it doesn't, please add a comment to the transaction with the details of the settled payment.

If the hold persists beyond 7 days, please contact our support team for further assistance. We'll be happy to investigate and help resolve the issue.

How can we help you with accounting and billing?

Pliant:

We offer an Accounting Export flow to help you export transactions for accounting purposes. Here's how you can do it:

  1. Go to the "Not exported" tab to prepare your transactions.
  2. Assign necessary details like subcategories, VAT rates, and teams.
  3. Select the transactions and click "Add export queue".
  4. In the "Export queue" tab, select the transactions you want to export.
  5. Click "Export selected" and configure your export settings.
  6. Click "Start export" to complete the process.

You can export in CSV, JSON, XML, or XLSX formats. The exported file will be emailed to you. Remember, once exported, transactions can't be edited, but you can re-export if needed.

Zsofia Den:

I have an error message after approving a payment, how can I solve the issue?

Pliant:

If you're experiencing an error message after approving a payment, it might be related to Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) or 3D Secure (3DS) verification. Here are some steps to resolve this:

  1. Ensure your Pliant web app is set up for 3DS verification.
  2. When making an online payment, wait for the 3DS challenge to appear in the Pliant web app.
  3. Confirm the transaction before the timer expires. If it does expire, you'll need to attempt the transaction again.
  4. If issues persist, try unpairing your mobile device and attempt the transaction again to receive an SMS code instead.

If you're still encountering problems, please reach out to our support team through our support form for further assistance.

Accounting and billing

Pliant:

How can we help you with accounting and billing?

Pliant:

To integrate DATEV with your accounting system, follow these steps:

  1. Submit a ticket to activate DATEV integration. We'll inform you once it's activated.
  2. Ensure prerequisites are met, including correct DATEV client setup and activation of DATEV Invoice Data Service 1.0.
  3. Set up the DATEV API in our app under Settings - Accounting - DATEV. Click "Connect DATEV Datenservices" and follow the authorization process.
  4. Export transactions to DATEV by selecting them and clicking "Export selected" in the Accounting export flow. Choose DATEV API, XML, or CSV format.

We offer three export options: CSV file download, XML file transfer, or API connection to DATEV Unternehmen Online. The API is set by default, but let us know if you prefer file downloads.


Sources:
Step 1: Activate DATEV Integration
Step 3: Setup of the DATEV API via DATEV Rechnungsdatenservice 1.0

Step 4: Export Transactions to DATEV

My credit card got hacked how can I get a refund?

Pliant:

If you've noticed unauthorized charges on your credit card, we can help you with a chargeback request. This is a process to return money to your account for suspicious transactions. Here's what you need to do:

  1. Contact our support team immediately through the chat in our web and mobile app or via our Support Form.
  2. Create a ticket explaining the unauthorized charges. Our customer support team will review your dispute to determine if it's valid.
  3. If accepted, the amount of the suspicious transactions will be credited back to your account. You'll see this as a "Chargeback" transaction on your account.

We take fraud prevention seriously and will work with Visa to thoroughly review your case.


Sources:
Requesting chargebacks
Visa fraud prevention measures

i need to increase my limit

Pliant:

There are a few ways to increase your limit:

  1. Request a credit limit change: Contact us via phone, chat, or our Support Form. We'll assess your company and respond as soon as possible.
  2. For individual cards: In the web or mobile app, go to "Wallet," find your card, and select "Request limit change." Enter the new limit and reason, then submit for approval.
  3. Top up your account: This adds funds without waiting for the bill payment schedule. It's useful for upcoming big expenses or when your credit limit is low.

Remember, we'll email you when you have 20% and 10% of your overall limit remaining.

We offer several features to help you manage your account's accounting information. You can access these features in the web app under Settings > Accounting. Here, you can set up general account numbers, manage company-specific data fields for pre-accounting, and configure accounting system integrations.

To get started, you'll need to activate and configure data fields, and define general account numbers. This includes setting up the Credit Card Account, Default Supplier Account, and Cash-in-transit Account.

For exporting transactions to your accounting system, we provide an Accounting Export flow. This three-step process allows you to prepare transactions, queue them for export, and view exported transactions.

Could you tell me which specific aspect of accounting information you're most interested in managing? This will help me provide more targeted guidance.

  1. Ensure you have the necessary permissions. Some integrations require admin or owner access to both Pliant and the integrated service.
  2. Verify that your account details match. For example, the email address should be the same on both Pliant and the integrated platform.
  3. Check if you've completed all setup steps. This may include connecting accounts, mapping G/L accounts, and setting up default suppliers or customers.
  4. Ensure prerequisites are met. Some integrations have specific requirements, like correct fiscal year settings or activated services on the partner platform.

If you're still having issues, please provide more details about the specific integration and the problem you're experiencing. We can then offer more targeted assistance.

Daisuke Kobayashi:

I see a charge that I don't recognize. Can I find out more about it?

Pliant:

Yes, you can find out more about a charge you don't recognize. We offer several ways to investigate and address this issue:

  1. Check your card transactions in the Pliant Cardholder App (web or mobile). You'll see details like the merchant, card used, and payment category for each transaction.
  2. If you suspect fraud, you can request a chargeback. Contact us through the chat in our mobile or web app, or submit a ticket via our Support Form. Our team will review the dispute and determine if it's valid.
  3. For suspicious activity, reach out to our support team as soon as possible. We have measures in place to detect and prevent fraudulent transactions, including two-factor and biometric authentication.

We're here to help you resolve any concerns about unrecognized charges on your account.


Sources:
Your card transactions

Pliant:

We offer enhanced transaction details for some merchants, especially those in the travel industry. Here's how you can find more information:

  1. Check the transaction window in the Pliant Cardholder App (web or mobile). Click on the specific transaction to see if additional details are available.
  2. Download the CSV file from the transactions page. It includes a column with additional merchant information for your transactions.
  3. Look for details like the card used, merchant name, and payment category for each transaction in the app.

If you still can't find the information you need, please contact our support team through the chat in our app or submit a ticket via our Support Form. We're here to help you resolve any concerns about unrecognized charges.

Pliant:

To find out exactly what you paid for from a specific merchant, you have a few options:

  1. Check the transaction details in the Pliant Cardholder App (web or mobile). Click on the specific transaction to see if enhanced information is available, especially for travel-related purchases.
  2. Download the CSV file from the transactions page. It includes a column with additional merchant information for your transactions.
  3. In the app, you'll see useful information like which card was used, the merchant name, and the payment category for each transaction.
  4. For virtual cards, you can access card details in the wallet section of the app by clicking "My Cards" and then "Show card details" on the desired card.

If you still can't find the specific information you need, please contact our support team through the chat in our app or submit a ticket via our Support Form. We're here to help you resolve any concerns about your transactions.

Flavio Panci:

why am i paying fees on non-‚Ç¨ payments?

Pliant:

We apply a fee to transactions made in currencies different from your card account's currency. These are called FX (foreign exchange) transactions. For example, if you have a EUR card and make a purchase in USD, it's considered an FX transaction.

The standard FX fee is 2%, but your organization might have a special rate. You can check your specific FX fee rate on the Organization > Plan page in your account settings.

These fees are calculated when the transaction is booked and added to your monthly invoice. For more details, you can find the FX fee per transaction and the applicable rate in your transaction CSV export.

Why is my transaction declined?

Pliant:

There are several reasons why your transaction might be declined. Common causes include:

  1. Locked card
  2. Card limit reached
  3. Organizational limit reached
  4. Wrong PIN entered
  5. Failed customer authentication
  6. Disallowed merchant
  7. Transaction in a prohibited or high-risk country

The decline reason, explanation, and recommended actions should be visible in the transaction detail window on the transactions page in our app.

If it's an online payment and the decline is due to failed cardholder authentication, please contact the merchant as they need to trigger the authentication process.

For unexpected declines, please reach out to us through the chat in our mobile or web app, or submit a ticket via our Support Form. We're here to help resolve any issues you may encounter.

Flavio Panci:

are payments made not in euro more expensive for me?

Pliant:

Yes, payments made in currencies other than your card account's currency are subject to an FX (foreign exchange) fee. We apply a 2% fee to each FX transaction, which is charged as part of your monthly fee invoice. For example, if you have a EUR card and make a transaction in USD, it would be considered an FX transaction. The fee is calculated when the transaction is booked and added to your monthly invoice. You can check your specific FX fee rate on the Organization > Plan page in your account settings.

Pliant:

There could be a few reasons why you might not be able to use your Pliant card:

  1. You're trying to use it at a disallowed merchant. We restrict usage at certain types of businesses, including gambling, tobacco stores, adult entertainment, and others.

If none of these apply, please check your card's status in the app or contact our support team for further assistance.

Hi, is it possible to issue cards to a team rather than an individual?

Pliant:

No, it's not possible to issue cards to a team rather than an individual. Each card must be issued to a specific person, and only that person can access the secure card details. When issuing a card, you must choose which member you want to issue it to. This is for security reasons, as card details should never be shared among multiple people.

However, we do offer alternative solutions for team-based spending. You can assign multiple members and their cards to a specific team and set a budget for that team. This allows team members to share the team budget rather than sharing a single card, which is more secure and flexible. If you'd like to learn more about these team-based solutions, please contact our customer service.

Can I delete a deactivated member

Pliant:

No, you cannot delete a deactivated member. When you deactivate a member, all their active cards are automatically terminated. However, deactivated members cannot be deleted because all transactions, including past ones, need to be assigned to a specific user. This ensures that transaction history remains intact and traceable. Deactivated users are not considered in billing, so there's no cost associated with keeping their account in the system.

Pliant:

How can we help you with accounting and billing?

Pliant:

To integrate DATEV with our accounting system, follow these steps:

  1. Contact our support at support@getpliant.com to activate DATEV for your organization.
  2. Ensure prerequisites are met, including correct DATEV client setup and activation of DATEV Invoice Data Service 1.0.
  3. Set up the DATEV API in our app under Settings - Accounting - DATEV. Click "Connect DATEV Datenservices" and follow the authorization process.
  4. To export transactions, go to the Accounting Export tab, select transactions, and add them to the export list. Click "Export selected" and choose DATEV API as the export format.

We offer three export options: CSV file download, XML file transfer, or API connection (set by default). Let us know if you prefer file downloads instead of the API method.

Pliant:

How can we help you with accounting and billing?

Pliant:

We offer integration with Oracle NetSuite for accounting and billing. Here's a brief overview of the process:

  1. Link Pliant to Oracle NetSuite in Settings > Accounting > Oracle NetSuite.
  2. Install the NetSuite bundle "AppLink" and enable necessary SuiteCloud features.
  3. Sync data from NetSuite, including G/L accounts, VAT rates, and suppliers.
  4. Set up general accounts and sync options in Pliant.
  5. Use Pliant's Accounting export flow to assign pre-accounting values to transactions.
  6. Push transaction and receipt data from Pliant to Oracle NetSuite.

To get started, do you have admin rights in both Pliant and Oracle NetSuite? This is necessary to complete the initial setup steps.
